title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.15.8 | 29-11-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: So, Arjuna is now recollecting the different incidents in the presence of the Supreme Lord.
segments.summary: This segment introduces the context of the lecture, focusing on the Pandavas' decision to retire after Krishna's departure and Arjuna's grief, highlighting Arjuna's remembrance of his friendship with Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Bhagavatam is summarizing those incidents to teach us a very important principle of devotional service.
segments.summary: This segment explains the meaning of the verse, focusing on Arjuna's past glories achieved through Krishna's grace, including saving Maya Danava and building the assembly house for the Rajasuya Yajna, emphasizing the importance of devotional service.

segments.key_quote: Arjuna is such a wonderful devotee that when somebody asks him for help he never refuses.
segments.summary: This segment elaborates on the story of Maya Danava seeking protection from Arjuna, highlighting Arjuna's compassion and the subsequent construction of the assembly house, which led to the Rajasuya sacrifice and tributes to Yudhishthira.

segments.key_quote: It was actually Krishna's desire that a pure devotee rule the world and lead people on the path of devotional service to achieve the ultimate liberation.
segments.summary: This segment discusses Yudhishthira's devotion to Krishna and Krishna's desire for a pure devotee to rule the world, emphasizing Yudhishthira's intention to glorify Krishna through the Rajasuya Yajna and the worship of Krishna in the assembly.

segments.key_quote: The modern demons are the harmful material scientists.
segments.summary: This segment explains the nature of demons and divine beings, drawing from the Bhagavad Gita, and equates modern demons with harmful material scientists who create disturbances in society, using the example of nuclear weapons.

segments.key_quote: So it is described devotees are more merciful than the Lord.
segments.summary: This segment discusses Maya's materialism and how he sought shelter from Arjuna to escape Krishna's Sudarshan Chakra, emphasizing the mercy of devotees and the importance of pleasing the devotee to please the Lord.
